entry.et: Middle English whos, genitive of who, what

def.dt: :of or relating to whom or which especially as possessor or possessors whose gorgeous vesture heaps the ground Robert Browning, agent or agents the law courts, whose decisions were important F. L. Mott, or object or objects of an action the first poem whose publication he ever sanctioned J. W. Krutch

entry.fl: pronoun, singular or plural in construction

def.dt: :that which belongs to whom used without a following noun as a pronoun equivalent in meaning to the adjective whose tell me whose it was Shakespeare
